intro: Witheringia sellowiana, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its berries, which are typically yellow or orange when ripe, contain toxic compounds and are not edible. Witheringia sellowiana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and riverbanks.
